fr.pyvain.websight.websight.PersonalDataGraph

Class Tree

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.pyvain.websight.websight.PersonalDataGraph.Tree

  • public class Tree
extends java.lang.Object

    A data tree is a structure built upon a connected component of a data graph, which is composed of :

    • a directed tree of vertices representing personal data of the user, which is defined by a set of vertices, a set of edges, a root, and a parent/children relation
    • a set of additional edges, which are the edges of the connected component which are not in the tree

    Additionally, the number of descendants of each vertex is stored in the data tree, to fasten the computation of a radial layout of the underlying connected component of the graph.

    Finally, this structure allows to shuffle the children of one of the vertices (which results in a different radial layout), and eventually to reverse this action (by storing the previous order).

      • getLastShuffled

        public Vertex getLastShuffled()
        Last vertex whose children have been shuffled getter.
        Returns:
        The last vertex whose children have been shuffled by a call to shuffleChildren(), null if it has not been called yet or if it has been canceled by a call to unshuffleChildren().

      • getPreShuffleOrder

        public java.util.List<Vertex> getPreShuffleOrder()
        Previous order of last children shuffled getter.
        Returns:
        a read only view of the previous order of the last children shuffled by a call to shuffleChildren(), null if it has not been called yet or if it has been canceled by a call to unshuffleChildren().

      • neighbourState

        public void neighbourState()
        Chooses a random Vertex of the data tree, and shuffles its children placing the tree in a "neighbour state".

      • previousState

        public void previousState()
        Places back the data tree in its previous "state", if the neighbourState() method was previously used to place it in a neighbour state.

      • shuffleChildren

        public void shuffleChildren(Vertex v)
        Randomly shuffles the children of the specified Vertex, and saves a copy of its previous state, to allow restoration thanks to the unshuffleChildren() method.
        Parameters:
        v - Vertex whose children must be shuffled

      • unshuffleChildren

        public void unshuffleChildren()
        When called after a call to shuffleChildren(), cancel its effect by restoring the previous order of the last shuffled children.

      • getNbDescendants

        public int getNbDescendants(Vertex v)
        Specific number of descendants getter.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex whose number of descendants is required
        Returns:
        the number of descendant of the specified Vertex if it is in the tree, -1 else

      • minimizeCrossings

        public void minimizeCrossings(int rad,
                              float secStart,
                              float secWidth,
                              float vRadius,
                              Tree wTree,
                              RadialLayout wLayout,
                              Drawing wDrawing,
                              long maxTime)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        With specified time, places the tree in a state (i.e. permutes the children lists of its vertices) which minimizes the cost of the drawing of this tree with specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        rad - Required radial coordinate of the tree's root
        secStart - Required angular sector starting angle of the tree's root
        secWidth - Required angular sector width of the tree's root
        vRadius - Required vertex Radius of the tree in percentage of the maximal allowed value, must be in ]0, 1[
        wTree - Working tree, previous content will be overwritten
        wLayout - Working layout, previous content will be overwritten
        wDrawing - Working drawing, previous content will be overwritten
        maxTime - Maximum time allocated to the minimization
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vertex radius is out of bounds

      • copy

        public void copy(Tree tree)
        Makes the receiving Tree a copy of the specified Tree
        Parameters:
        tree - Tree to copy

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Two trees are equal if they have equal vertices, edges, and are in the same state (i.e. same root, parent/children relation, last children shuffle and previous children)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - Object to compare with the receiving Tree
        Returns:
        True if and only if o is an Tree, and it is equal to the receiving Tree.
